result.execSummary:
The defendant Charles Edward Combs was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA, and Domestic Abuse assessments out of bail on deposit, if any or to be paid during the period of probation on case 15CM002704. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.

*ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.

Consecutive to: To case 15CM002704; but to run CONCURRENT as to Count 2 with credit for 0 days time served. Straight Time.
Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

* No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*Maintain full time/part time employment and or schooling. Court will allow for Huber privileges for work and treatment after serving 6 Months of his sentence.
*No contact with the victim unless authorized by the Court and or agent.
*As a Convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons. Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
Consecutive to: To case 15CM002704; but to run CONCURRENT as to Count 1 with credit for 0 days time served. Straight Time.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Charles Edward Combs in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Defendant Charles Edward Combs in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1:  THE COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve  7 MONTHS, STRAIGHT TIME, in the House of Correction (HOC), consecutive to case 15CM002704; but to run concurrent as to Count 2 with credit for 0 days time served.  

AS TO COUNT 2:  THE COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 90 DAYS, STRAIGHT TIME, in the House of Correction (HOC), consecutive to case 15CM002704; but to run concurrent as to Count 1 with credit for 0 days time served.  

Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding. 
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA, and Domestic Abuse assessments out of bail on deposit, if any or to be paid during the period of probation on case 15CM002704. Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling. Court will allow for Huber privileges for work and treatment after serving 6 Months of his sentence.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  No contact with the victim unless authorized by the Court and or agent.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab for testing.
*  As a Convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms or weapons.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.

Received and filed with court:
*  Crime Victim Impact Statement

Attorney Justin Singleton in court, defendant Charles Edward Combs not in court, in custody.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for sentencing however, the defendant was not produced.  State to provide a new offer due to the defendant's new case, 15CM2704. Court ordered the defendant remanded pending sentencing. Case adjourned to Branch 38.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA HEARING commencing JULY 20, 2015 received and filed. (16 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to JUSTIN L. SINGLETON  400 W. MORELAND BLVD.  WAUKESHA, WI 53188

Defendant Charles Edward Combs in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
State orally amended the compaint to change the name of the victim to Brittany N.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1 and COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 38 on 9-11-2015 at 8:15 am.  Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  All conditions of bail are continued until further order of the Court.   mld

Defendant Charles Edward Combs in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Pursuant to plea negotiations, upon the motion of the State, Court AMENDED the Charge of COUNT #1 to Battery, Contrary to Wisconsin State Statute(s) 940.19(1), a Class A Misdemeanor."  mld

Defendant Charles Edward Combs in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 7-20-2015 at 8:30 am.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date, signed and filed.   mld

Defendant Charles Edward Combs in court with attorney Justin Singleton.  Abbey Marie DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  City of Greenfield Police Officer Eric Lindstrom.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss without argument heard and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Discovery and offer letter turned over to defense counsel, per the State.  Case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-18-2015 at 8:30 am.  All conditions of bail are continued, including no contact with Brittany N. or JSC, until further order of the Court.  mld

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brittany N. and JSC 10/10/2014.

Defendant Charles Edward Combs in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Charles Edward Combs in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY to Count 2. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
